item.title: üçë How to Acquire Language Scientifically
item.description:
This article mainly introduces some practical methods to acquire foreign languages ‚Äã‚Äãscientifically. The reference book is Science of Foreign Language acquisition

  1. Focus on Single Area for Input
  • Pick materials that you are interested in
  • Repeatedly listen to the material that you can understand 80% of the content (understandable input)
  • Change simply “learning” foreign languages in‚Äã‚Äãto “using” foreign languages ‚Äã‚Äãto obtain information
    • For example, listen to the same news in your native language in the morning and a foreign language in the evening.
    • The brain is processing speech information (pronunciation, rhythm, etc.) even if the content is incomprehensible
  1. The Role of Reciting Example Sentences
  • Expand your database
  • recite dialogues, sentences, expressions
  • Cultivate basic social communication skills
  1. Insist on Making Some Output Every Day
  • Speak + Write
  • Keep a diary, record self-talk, talk with foreign language learning partners, participate in foreign language corners, comment on the input materials heard and read in foreign languages ‚Äã‚Äãin online chat.
  • Improve the brain’s processing speed when foreign language information is input.
  • Normalize foreign language practice
  • The first principle of speaking is to convey meaning. If you have more time and energy, pay attention to whether the sentence is correct and whether the pronunciation is standard
  • Striking a balance between correctness and fluency
  1. Communication Strategy
  • “Buy time”(use I think, besides… instead of em… uhh…) especially in your intermediate stages of language acquisition
  • Interpretation method. Choose another expression.
  1. Meaningless Learning and Meaningful Acquisition
  • Memorizing - meaningless learning - difficult
  • Illustration, storytelling, homophony, contextual memory
  1. Memorize Words in Context
  • When encountering words that you cannot understand, guess the meaning first, and then look up the dictionary
  • While remembering the meaning of the word, you can remember the collocation
    • Especially suitable for memorizing verbs
  • Acquire the connection information
  • recite derivatives with prefixes and suffixes
  1. Learning Pronunciation Shall Starts with Imitation
  • Consciously identify sounds that are difficult for you
  • For audio materials that you already understand the meaning and grammar, you can further imitate the pronunciation, rhythm, intonation, and use the “shadow practice method”
  • Interest for pronunciation. Choose the type of pronunciation you are interested in (e.g. actors you like)
  • Retelling interview material is better than film clips, because the lines in the film do not necessarily correspond to real life.
  • For native speakers, what matters is not the pronunciation of individual vowels and consonants, but the overall intonation and rhythm. (feature imitation)
  1. Master the Basic Grammar to Make Sentences
  • The learner only needs to master the basic grammar knowledge (about the third grade to the senior one level) from completely ignorant to being able to output. If you want to further understand the input content, it is better to master some slightly more complicated grammar knowledge.
  • If you encounter some complex grammars that you can’t even understand, you can ignore them completely, because the time investment is too expensive and the effect is poor.
  1. Improve Learning Motivation
  • Learning motivation is not good or bad, as long as you can enjoy it.
  • Increase the interest in foreign culture (virtuous circle).
  1. Find Your Own Learning Strategy
  • Characteristics of excellent foreign language learners:
    • Pay attention to language form (written or oral)
    • Emphasis on communication and willingness to use language
    • Actively participate in learning activities
    • Follow the learning process
    • Use learning strategies flexibly
  1. Input Mode Demonstration
  • Natural Pedagogy - Grammar can be reserved for after-school learning, and students should be given comprehensible input practice in class.
  • Input-interaction mode - simulate interviews with learned grammar, communicate around things around you, covering various sentence patterns and expressions.

item.description:
This article mainly introduces the use of Emoji in the Hugo framework, adding cute emoji to your blog posts.

Method to realize

Displaying Emoji in the article can directly call the emojify function and use the [Inline Shortcodes](https://gohugo.io/templates/shortcode-templates/#inline- shortcodes) function implementation.

p.s.: After opening InlineShortcodes, it will have many powerful functions, such as inserting YouTube videos, etc.

Here is just a chance to enjoy Jinyoung’s “Dive” with you~~

If you need to use it globally, you need to put “config.toml, config.yaml, or config.json” in the root directory of the website (according to the specific situation, my file is config.toml, so the following code is also modified by the .toml file For example. For the modification method of other files, please refer to the content in the Inline Shortcodes link above) Add two lines of code to the file:

item.title: üçë How to Build Your Blog using Hugo
item.description:
Hugo is written by Go Language and can help us build a beautiful blog in a very short time„ÄÇ

Install Hugo

MAC 

brew install hugo
hugo version

WIN

  1. Download corresponding .zip document in the hugo release page
  2. unzip hugo.exe file and put it into D:\Software\hugo(You can choose your own path)
  3. add the above into path
    • Right click my computer
    • Attributes
    • Advanced system settings
    • environment variables
    • double click path
    • new path
  4. Restart the terminal, run hugo version. The version number indicates success.

Build a Blog

Enter hugo official websiteÔºàhttps://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/Ôºâ, follow the steps to build it step by step.

NoticeÔºö

hugo new site quickstart

The quickstart need to be changed into your github repository name and add -generator.

Create a New Terminal

  1. Run hugo in the terminal (generate the public folder); you can also use hugo -F --cleanDestinationDir (generate a new folder)
  2. Create a new .gitignore on the outermost side and enter:

/public/
which means ignore my public, it will become a new folder alone.

  1. cd public
  2. git init
  3. git add .
  4. git remote add origin git@github.com:[your user name]]/[your user name].github.io.git
  5. git branch -M main
  6. git push -u origin main

Create the Second Article

  1. Run hugo new posts/the Second Article.md in xxx.github.io-creator (Make sure you are not in public )
  2. Run code posts/the Second Article.md to edit the file. Make sure not the delete the original content and write in another line to input your content.
  3. Run hugo -D to get the new public
  4. Enter public for next step
    1. git add . (Don’t forget the .)
    2. git commit -m update
    3. git push -f (Force upload)
  5. Wait a few minutes for a second post to appear on your blog!

Upload Pic

Method1

  1. Open the sm.ms website, upload the picture, and get the url of the picture.
  2. Use ![](url) to show the pic in your article.

Method2

  1. Store the image file 1.png in the static directory and get static/1.png
  2. Write ![](/1.png) in the blog Markdown to see the image corresponding to static/1.png
  3. If you want to create an images directory in static, just create it directly, and add /images in front of the corresponding image, for example
    1. Put the image file 2.png in the static/images directory to get static/images/2.png
    2. Just write ![](/images/2.png) in the blog

In addition, you can also Google “Hugo insert picture” to find the answer.
